name: Soccer Mix No. 1 Quiz | Soccer | 25 Questions

questions.text: Which ' A ' did Patrick Vieira leave to join Arsenal in 1996?
questions.explanation:
AC Milan.

	Vieira started his career at Cannes before moving to AC Milan where he only played twice. Arsenal bought him for 3.5m pounds in August 1996.

questions.text: Which ' B ' played 46 times for Croatia as well as starring for AC Milan, Bari and Celta Vigo in domestic football?
questions.explanation:
Boban.

	Zvonimir Boban was once suspended from the national team for punching a policeman.

questions.text: Which ' C ' played in the World Cup Finals in Mexico in 1986?
questions.explanation:
Canada.

	Cameroon, Colombia and Cambodia didn't qualify for the 1986 World Cup. Canada were knocked out of the group stages in Mexico, losing each of their three games and failing to score a single goal.

questions.text: Which ' D ' had a Chairman who was a former safecracker?
questions.explanation:
Darlington.

	Darlington were on the brink of bankruptcy until multi-millionaire George Reynolds saved the club.

questions.text: What ' E ' comes after 'San Jose' to make the name of a football (soccer) club from the USA?
questions.explanation:
Earthquakes.

	San Jose Earthquakes.

questions.text: What ' F ' is the surname of Antonio and Emanuele - the twins who both played for Brescia?
questions.explanation: Filippini.

questions.text: Which ' G ' from the following has NOT won a league title in their respective country?
questions.explanation:
Groningen.

	Genoa have won 9 Italian Championships - there last one was in 1923-24. Grasshoppers are the most successful Swiss club as are Galatasaray in Turkey.

questions.text: Which ' H ' was sent off, along with his team mate Mike Flanagan, for fighting with him in an FA Cup tie in 1979?
questions.explanation:
Hales (Derek).

	Derek Hales and Mike Flanagan were playing for Charlton Athletic at the time.

questions.text: Which ' I ' declined to play in the 1950 World Cup Finals because they weren't allowed to play in bare feet?
questions.explanation:
India.

	India had initially failed to qualify for the 1950 World Cup Finals, but because of the withdrawal of other nations, they were invited to compete.

questions.text: Which ' J ' from the following is a club from Luxembourg?
questions.explanation:
Jeunesse Esch.

	Jablonec are from the Czech Republic. Jokerit are from Finland. Jaen are from Spain.

questions.text: Which ' K ' was diagnosed with a condition known as 'hole in the heart'?
questions.explanation:
Kanu.

	Nwankwo Kanu was diagnosed with this condition during his Inter Milan days. Kanu founded the Nwankwo Kanu Heart Foundation in August 2000 to help others with heart conditions.

questions.text: Which ' L ' from the following is NOT a club from France?
questions.explanation:
La Louviere.

	La Louviere come from Belgium.

questions.text: Which ' M ' was the venue where England beat West Germany 3-0, in 1985?
questions.explanation:
Mexico City.

	This was a friendly match where Kerry Dixon scored twice and Bryan Robson scored the other. Peter Shilton saved his one and only international penalty in this match too.

questions.text: Which ' N ' won the League Cup in 1985?
questions.explanation:
Norwich City.

	Norwich beat Sunderland 1-0 in the final and ironically both teams were relegated from the old first division in the same year.

questions.text: Which ' O ' were the first British club to install floodlights at their ground in 1950?
questions.explanation:
Oxford United & Oxford.

	At the time Oxford were known as Headington. The first Scottish club to install floodlights was Stenhousemuir in 1951.

questions.text: Which ' P ' was the venue for the 2002 World Cup draw?
questions.explanation:
Pusan.

	Pusan is in South Korea.

questions.text: Which ' Q ' plays its home games in the Scottish town of Dumfries?
questions.explanation:
Queen Of The South.

	They play at Palmerston Park. Queen of the South are the only British football team with their name in The Bible!

questions.text: Which ' R ' was the top scorer for Brazil in the 1994 World Cup Finals in the U.S.A?
questions.explanation:
Romario.

	Romario scored 5, one less than Stoichkov of Bulgaria and Salenko of Russia - who were the joint top scorers in the tournament.

questions.text: Which ' S ' left Real Madrid for Inter Milan in December 1999 - a month after saying, 'People can come knocking on my door, offering a lot of money, but I'm not moving. I'm happy in Madrid. I'm at the best club in the world, where we're pushing for more trophies.'?
questions.explanation: Seedorf.

questions.text: What ' T ' is the total number of goals Trevor Francis scored for England?
questions.explanation:
Twelve.

	Francis played 52 times for England.

questions.text: What ' U ' is infamous for its sloping pitch and the home of Barnet FC?
questions.explanation: Underhill.

questions.text: Which ' V ' was given the nickname 'El Tren' (The Train)?
questions.explanation:
Valencia (Adolfo).

	Valencia has played for Colombia in the 1994 and 1998 World Cup Finals.

questions.text: Which ' W ' is the only club to become champions of each of the English four divisions?
questions.explanation:
Wolverhampton Wanderers.

	Division 1 Champions 1953-54, 1957-58, 1958-59Division 2 Champions 1931-32, 1976-77Division 3 Champions 1988-89Division 4 Champions 1987-88

questions.text: Which ' X ' moved to rivals Liverpool from Everton in February 2002?
questions.explanation: Xavier.

questions.text: Which ' Y ' or ' Z ' from the following is the only one NOT to play in the English Premiership in the 1990s?
questions.explanation:
Zahovic.

	Tony Yeboah played for Leeds United between 1995 and 1997. Theo Zagorakis played for Leicester City between 1998 and 2000. Dwight Yorke has played in the top flight for Aston Villa and Manchester United.
